drug_info.name: TALVEY®
drug_info.class: first in class TCR BsAb targeting GPRC5D
drug_info.data_source_summary: Consolidated data based on the Claims Matrix, reflecting longer-term follow-up from the MonumenTAL-1 trial (e.g., ASCO 2025, EHA 2024/2025 presentations).
references: TALVEY® SmPC (EU), 2025.
Chari A et al. Lancet Haematol 2025; 12(4):e269–e281.
Einsele H et al. Adv Ther 2024; 41(4):1576–e1593.

indication.primary: Monotherapy for the treatment of adult patients with TCE R/R MM who have received at least 3 prior therapies, including an immunomodulatory agent, a proteasome inhibitor and an anti CD38 antibody, and have demonstrated disease progression on the last therapy.
requirements: Including an immunomodulatory agent, a proteasome inhibitor and an anti CD38 antibody
references: TALVEY® SmPC (EU), 2025.

mechanism.target_description: GPRC5D is a novel target highly expressed on MM cells, independent of BCMA expression.
mechanism.action: TALVEY® is a BsAb that targets GPRC5D expressing malignant plasma cells and CD3 on T cells.
advantages: Preserves patients’ B cells to help maintain their immune response.
GPRC5D has little to no expression on normal human haematopoietic cells, including B cells and bone marrow progenitors.
references: TALVEY® SmPC (EU), 2025.
Kodama T et al. Mol Cancer Ther 2019; 18(9):1555–1564.
Atamaniuk J et al. Eur J Clin Invest 2012; 42(9):953–960.
Einsele H et al. Adv Ther 2024; 41(4):1576–1593.
Schinke C et al. Blood Adv 2025; doi:10.1182/bloodadvances.2025016613.
Smith EL et al. Sci Transl Med 2019; 11(485):eaau7746.

primary_trial.name: MonumenTAL-1
primary_trial.design: Phase I/II, single arm, open label, multicentre study.
primary_trial.patient_population: adult patients with triple class exposed R/R MM
references: TALVEY® SmPC (EU), 2025.
Rasche L et al. Presented at: American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) Congress; 30 May–3 June 2025; Chicago, IL (Poster no. 96).
Chari A et al. N Engl J Med 2022; 387(24):2232–2244.
Chari A et al. Lancet Haematol 2025; 12(4):e269–e281.
Rasche L et al. Presented at: American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) Congress; 30 May–3 June 2025; Chicago, IL (Poster no. 96).
Rasche L et al. Presented at: American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) Congress; 30 May–3 June 2025; Chicago, IL (Poster no. 96).

cohorts.dosing_schedule: 0.4 mg/kg weekly SC or 0.8 mg/kg biweekly SC

references: Rasche L et al. Presented at: American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) Congress; 30 May–3 June 2025; Chicago, IL (Poster no. 96).
Chari A et al. Lancet Haematol 2025; 12(4):e269–e281.
Rasche L et al. Presented at: European Hematology Association (EHA) Congress; 13–16 June 2024; Madrid, Spain (Poster no. P915).
Ye JC et al. Presented at: International Myeloma Society (IMS) Annual Meeting; 25–28 September 2024; Rio de Janeiro, Brazil (Poster no. P-098).

standard_of_care_outcomes.summary: Clinical outcomes observed with real-world Standard of Care treatments in TCE R/R MM patients from pooled analysis.
references: Weisel K et al. Presented at: European Hematology Association (EHA) Congress; 12–15 June 2025; Milan, Italy (Poster no. PS1783).
Einsele H et al. Adv Ther 2024; 41(4):1576–1593.
Einsele H et al. Presented at: European Hematology Association (EHA) Congress; 12–15 June 2025; Milan, Italy (Poster no. PS1737).
Weisel K et al. Presented at: European Hematology Association (EHA) Congress; 12–15 June 2025; Milan, Italy (Poster no. PS1783).

sequential_therapy_outcomes.summary: Efficacy of subsequent T-cell redirecting therapies was retained after patients had received TALVEY®.
references: Sanchez L et al. Presented at: 65th American Society of Hematology (ASH) Annual Meeting and Exposition; 9–12 December 2023; San Diego, CA (Presentation no. 2007).
TALVEY® SmPC (EU), 2025.
Chari A et al. Lancet Haematol 2025; 12(4):e269–e281.
TALVEY® SmPC (EU), 2025.
Rasche L et al. Presented at: American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) Congress; 30 May–3 June 2025; Chicago, IL (Poster no. 96).
crs.notes: The majority of CRS events were Grade 1 or 2, and generally occurred during the step up dosing phase or with the initial treatment dose.

references: Chari A et al. Lancet Haematol 2025; 12(4):e269–e281.
TALVEY® SmPC (EU), 2025.
Rasche L et al. Presented at: American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) Congress; 30 May–3 June 2025; Chicago, IL (Poster no. 96).
Rasche L et al. Presented at: American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) Congress; 30 May–3 June 2025; Chicago, IL (Poster no. 96).
newly_identified_signals.prevalence: Low (1 patient in the biweekly cohort)
newly_identified_signals.source_observation: Identified during the >=2.5 year follow up of the MonumenTAL 1 trial

references: Schinke C et al. Cancer 2025; 131(14):e35927.
patient_reported_outcomes.source_population: Phase II of the MonumenTAL 1 trial in 118 patients receiving TALVEY® 0.8 mg/kg biweekly.
patient_reported_outcomes.summary: Patients with R/R MM who received biweekly TALVEY® reported meaningful improvements in HRQoL measures, including pain and fatigue.

references: TALVEY® SmPC (EU), 2025.
dosing_administration.step_up_dosing: Required to reduce the risk of CRS.
dosing_administration.premedication: Pretreatment with a corticosteroid, antihistamine and antipyretic is required 1–3 hours prior to administration of each step up dose.
dosing_administration.monitoring: Patients should be monitored for 48 hours after administration of all doses within the step up dosing phase for signs and symptoms of CRS and ICANS.
dosing_administration.treatment_duration: Until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

references: Soefje S et al. Presented at: European Hematology Association (EHA) Congress; 12–15 June 2025; Milan, Italy (Poster no. PS1764).
Lund T et al. Eur J Haematol 2025; 115(4):358–366.
outpatient_administration.feasibility: Outpatient administration is considered feasible and is expected to provide benefits to patients and healthcare centres.
outpatient_administration.findings: AEs associated with step up dosing were manageable in outpatient settings, and patients had a reduced length of hospital stay vs. inpatient delivery.

references: Janakiram M et al. Presented at: 66th American Society of Hematology (ASH) Annual Meeting and Exposition; 7–10 December 2024; San Diego, CA (Abstract no. 3368).
Rasche L et al. Presented at: American Society of Clinical Oncology (ASCO) Congress; 30 May–3 June 2025; Chicago, IL (Poster no. 96).
efficacy_and_safety_outcomes.source: Retrospective real world study from 7 IMF MM academic centers (N=118).
efficacy_and_safety_outcomes.conclusion: The ORR is consistent with the ORR of 67% achieved in BCMA TCR therapy exposed patients in the MonumenTAL 1 trial.

references: Dimopoulos MA et al. Nat Rev Clin Oncol 2025; 22(9):680–700.
treatment_guideline_recommendations.recommendation: TALVEY® is recommended for use at second or subsequent relapse.
